column5: There's not a lot of fishable ice south of Toronto, but there are a few nice impoundments, ponds and lakes with 5-6" of ice. Suitable for taking a stroll and having a wee look see. Bite has been soft and real slow. Not aggressive at all. Even so still managed to catch myself a breakfast for me and the pooches.  I think the weekend weather might put a stop to things for a few days.

Bruce...you got out and got some fresh air and a few fish...AND got to torture use with some fish fry porn. Sounds like good times to me   I can't wait to get down your way for my yearly winter smelt expedition. But with this mild weather coming I know it won't be anytime soon.

Glad you got out Bruce    and able to get yourself a nice little lunch even with the slow bite  Yeah that weather coming is going to make a mess of the good ice we have so far   I took a day of rest today since my daughter wanted to sleep in and I'm good with that  Thanks for sharing Jacques
now you have done it  I'm hungry  nice going
Do I understand this correctly...fish come fileted and pre-breaded in Toronto? A time saver to say the least!!
The magic of genetic engineering I like posting the after pics far more than the kitchen sink.
Wish I had some fish to cook   Nice job, looks great!  MTBF
